page.title: 14REED'S SCHOOL,COBHAM
page.content: Reed's School was founded in 1813 for boys with no fathers. Today a child with no, or one, parent is still taken into special account. The school now holds 340 boys aged between 11 and 18 and is divided into Junior and Senior schools and then into other forms. Some boys board and the rest go daily. The school has an imitation 17th century main building. It also has large sport facilities, and different houses for boarders, staff and classes. Reed's School covers 50 acres of woodland and heath. The grounds are well kept and round the main building there are modern buildings and old sheds and stables converted for school use, plus a building under construction.
